alert.note: Alert for Gates (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 23 at 12:04PM EDT until September 23 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast North Carolina, including the following counties, Bertie, Chowan, Gates, Hertford and Northampton. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1204 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ahoskie, Windsor, Murfreesboro, Rich Square, Aulander, Gatesville, Chowan University, Ryland, Sunbury, Gates, Conway, Woodland, Winton, Seaboard, Lewiston Woodville, Cofield, Powellsville, Roxobel, Colerain and Harrellsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
